TaxonIdentification.subspecies_authority: (P. V. Wells) V. T. Parker, M. C. Vasey & J. E. Keeley

treatment.description: Shrubs prostrate, 0.1–0.5 m; young twigs gray-tomentose. Leaf blades orbiculate-elliptic, 1–2.2 × 1–1.5 cm. Fruits 4–5 mm diam. 2n = 52.
treatment.habitat: Maritime chaparral, coastal prairie on serpentine soils
treatment.discussion: Subspecies ravenii occurs near the coast in San Francisco County. The relationship of this taxon is problematic; only one living individual is known from the wild. It is in the Center for Plant Conservation’s National Collection of Endangered Plants as Arctostaphylos hookeri subsp. ravenii.
